result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber R. Cornejo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber R. Cornejo

records.addlTxt:
Order on Defendant's Request for Release Modification or Change in Sentence
It is ordered that the Motion Hearing scheduled for 10/07/2022 is removed from the calendar. The Court approves Huber so long as defendant is compliant with jail rules.

Cases called at 11:53 AM: 20CM827, 21CM392, 22CM659.
Defendant Amber R. Cornejo in court, in custody with Attorney Ryan Kohler. Attorney Afton Lewis appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement has been reached. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
22CM659: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2: Disorderly Conduct; Repeater; Domestic Abuse. 
18 Months of Initial Confinement and 18 Months of Extended Supervision are Imposed and Stayed and the Defendant is placed on 2 Years of Probation with the following conditions:
No acts or threats of violence towards anyone. Domestic Evaluation and follow through with recommendations. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Court Costs/surcharges. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Pay remaining Restitution from case 20CM827.  
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.  Defendant is granted 2 days of sentence credit.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be the same as the conditions of Probation. 
20CM827: Count 3: Defendant is sentenced to 6 Months of Jail concurrent to 21CM392. Defendant is granted 65 days of sentence credit. 
21CM392: Defendant is sentenced to 6 Months of Jail on Count 1 and Count 2 concurrent to one another and 20CM827. Defendant is granted 65 days of sentence credit.

(Case called at 9:30 AM) Defendant Amber R. Cornejo in court with Attorney Ryan Glenn Kohler. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates this case is scheduled with other cases in front of Branch 4- requests new return hearing. 
Hearing: 10/24/2022 at 9:30 AM.
Dated 09/08/2022 from Court to Attorney Amundson and ADA Lewis regarding transferring of case for revocation sentencing.
Plea hearing on September 21, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Conditions: 
No contact with Festival Foods property.
Contact with J.S. through electronic means only.
Letter to defendant with amended signature bond ordered by court 8/17/2022. Request to return signed bond and Affidavit of Witness form to Clerk of Court no later than 8/26/2022.

Conditions: 
No contact with Festival Foods property.
Contact with J.S. through electronic means only.

Court order to amend bond and conditions of bond to remove the condition of no contact with J.S. and add the condition of contact with J.S. through electronic means only. All other conditions of bond shall remain in effect until further order of the Court.
